contenido:
The U.S. Department of Agriculture is gathering information on a cow that was ordered destroyed at a West Texas meatpacking plant, as reported by a USDA official on Friday.

A USDA spokesman, Ed Loyd, stated that he did not have confirmation on why the cow was killed on Wednesday, and added that it was unclear whether a tissue sample had been taken for a test for bovine spongiform encephalopathy, also known as mad cow disease.

Loyd emphasized that while there were indications of a problem with the animal, they could not conclude that it had BSE. He explained that testing was conducted due to these concerns.
